unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Variable of Interest: Car Color
question_text:
Suppose $30\%$ of all cars in a certain town are red.
If the variable of interest is the number of cars that drive by until a red car is seen, what is the center and shape of this distribution?
solution:
The mean of a geometric distribution is $\frac{1}{P}$, where $P$ is the probability of success. In this situation, $\text{mean} = \frac{1}{0.3} = 3.33$. Do not round this value to a whole number.

Geometric distributions will always be right skewed. To get an idea what this distribution looks like, observe the following:

$P(X = 1) = 0.3$
$P(X = 2) = 0.7\cdot 0.3 = 0.21$
$P(X = 3) = 0.7\cdot 0.7\cdot 0.3 = 0.147$
$P(X = 4) = 0.7\cdot 0.7\cdot 0.7\cdot 0.3 = 0.1029$

As X increases, each probability decreases; therefore; the distribution will have a longer right tail.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
